intro: Mesembryanthemum dunense, commonly known as the Dun Mountain ice plant, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and stems. It typically blooms in spring, producing vibrant yellow or orange flowers that attract pollinators. Mesembryanthemum dunense is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
